name: Insecticide Part 1
description: Enter the fast shooting world of INSECTICIDE as hot shot rookie Detective Chrys Liszt and help solve a crime of epic proportions. Lead your team on a bug hunt, collecting clues and solving puzzles. Use old-fashioned street smarts, unique insect abilities and an arsenal of ingenious bug weapons to confront your suspects.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista Processor: 1.5GHz processor or better Memory: 256 MB Graphics: 16-bit Graphics, DirectX 9 (shader 2.0) compatible video card, 64 MB minimum video memory DirectX Version: 9.0c Sound: DirectX compatible sound card Hard Drive: 600 MB

reviews.review_text: I'm only 9 minutes in and I've probably encountered about a dozen insect puns.  It doesn't bug me at all.

I would recommend then game, it is cute, fun and interesting.   But as a warning there is no other parts   ask the wiki stats  'The PC version was to be released as two downloadable episodes with a retail version following soon afterward, but the second episode never materialized due to Gamecock being acquired by SouthPeak Games in 2008 and the latter deciding to cancel the inherited title' it was later released on the DS as a full game, heavily scaled down. 'In order to complete the story for PC gamers, Crackpot expressed a desire to upload the cinematics for Part 2 (as well as Part 1) on their official YouTube page, '
It's like Bug's Life with guns! -IGN

I never knew a game about bugs could be full of so many bugs. I shouldn't have impulse bought this game when it was on sale. 'Oh, it's only like 50 cents.' I would have rather gotten a gumball, I might have enjoyed that longer.

Terrible just terrible how other detective games comapre to this game. With its super realistic and relatable characters I dont understand why they arent charging full price for this game. At the low price of 3 dollars you get a great storyline, Interesting potaganist, hot fast action, hillarious jokes and great puns. With its compelling storyline you become compleetely emerged into the story and actually feel like you are a bug and you want to rome the streets fighting crime for great power comes great responsibility. I have to say there will never be as good as game as Insecticide except part two of course, I wonder if they will ever release it on PC.   10/10
Just because this game is cheap, doesn't mean its a good game. Its really bad. I didn't know that until I played it.
Can't be beat for $.29
It has about 3 bug puns which the character cycles through every minute.

This game has a number of things going for it but some pretty major flaws. It is an interesting mix of point and click and shooter. The characters are well designed and likeable. The voice acting is good and I love the word play. The story as far as it goes is decent but there is no getting away from the fact that this is only half the game; just as it gets into its swing the game ends. There are a couple of frustrating bits too where I wasn’t sure what I was supposed to be doing. So as long as you manage your expectations then this game provides a few hours of enjoyable entertainment.
Spent 35 minutes looking for cream for a cockroach for his coffee after giving the fat ♥♥♥♥ a donut 10/10

This game perplexes me. Graphics are stylized quit nicely, but lip syncing is nonexistent. Bug puns exist literally everywhere, but most of them are forced. Enemies rarely hit you, but dodge your slow-moving bullets easily. Enemy AI is near perfect at dodging, but their pathing is awful and often leads to them running back and forth. Despite enemies practically never shooting directly at you, extra health is everywhere. Bullets deal miniscule damage but kicks instantly kill. To top it all off, the second leve, which I'm assuming is a 'Puzzle' level, asks you do to a large number of completely unprompted and largely unaided tasks. The platforming sucks too because of how badly your character controls while in the air.  I ended up paying about 30 cents and I still wasn't happy with it. At least it isn't buggy.
9 minutes of bad puns and incredibly below par 3rd person shooting. Looks and feels like its one of the PS1 releases that nobody remembers.  2/10

-sigh- I really wanted to like this game. it felt like they had a idea here, but didn't know how to make a game. and really what I could say about this game. the game is repeating itself waay to much, where it gets plain right boring just from the start. I did not push this game, because I didn't want be in pain with boredom...
too hard to complete the game.

Really nice game, in the vein of PC/PSX/PS2 platformers of the late 90's and early 00's. Gave me a bit of nostalgia for the genre. Decent voice acting, the graphics are plain in today's day and age but they have their charm. Recomended especially if you grew up on spyro, jak and daxter, ratchet and clank. Also, got it on a sale for 29 cents. Great value for the money.
♥♥♥♥♥♥ Zootopia: The Shooter. Also never going to be completed.
It was good but far too short, only get if on sale.

To be clear, I bought the game to see the female protagonist in action. She's a bug but I like her style being a female lead in a Noir-type setting. It's quite unique. Despite all the negatives I am listing below, I still don't regret getting the game while it was on sale.  The game does have some issues for me though so here we go:  1) Screen resolutions. It has oddball resolutions and none fit my screen. Best to play it on windowed mode if you're out of luck in their limited selection.  2) Setting mouse sensitivity all the way down will actually disable your mouse.  3) You need to save the changes before changing tabs in the optons menu. O.o;  4) No tutorial I think.   5) You have a double jump. I wish I knew that before the first platform leap (which you can't do without double jumping).  6) I feel that the ammo recharge is pretty slow.  7) You can just double jump from behind cover to pop the AI enemies hiding behind cover while in mid-air.

This game is even better than Painkiller Overdose i've bought recently! NO JOKE! I like old games like that: just jumpin and runnin' around the level, killing some freaks and reaching destination. IT EVEN HAS QUEST ELEMENTS! 7,5/10
Killing lots of bugs and solving some puzzles is a bargain at this price
It is rather unfortunate that this game that won't be getting a sequel that was promised in its very title.  Still perhaps if we bought enough these we might get the ball rolling again.
I'd like to see Part 2 or perhaps a cartoon/anime series and even toy lines and stuff. Such a shame the new company decided to cancel this.
